page.title: 02Kate Kennedy, St.Andrews
page.content: {The Kate Kennedy Pageant,}a colourful costume procession, takes place annually in the streets of St. Andrews.The principal members of the cast are drawn from the {Kate Kennedy {Club}whose members are students or members of staff in the University of St. Andrews.They are assisted by a small group of eleven year old boys from one of the local primary schools who act as pages. Although the origins of this pageant are fairly obscure it is generally accepted that it started as a student 'rag' when one student dressed up as {Katherine Kennedy, {legendary niece of Bishop James {Kennedy.}The pageant has developed over the years and now has a cast of around seventy which includes well known characters of university and town through the ages.
